review: Well, Chromecast is a cool concept; however, it does tie up one product to use the Chromecast.  IE you have to use your phone, tablet, or other device to use the Chromecast.  This isn't normally a problem, unless you consider that using your phone/tablet ties that item up until you're done using the Chromecast; however, with Amazon or Roku, you can use that product to view whatever it is you're wanting to view, and not tie up your phone/tablet.  Something to consider.  Had I known this, I could have gone for the Amazon product.. or Roku.
author: Bill Hickman "Big dawg Herk"

review: I've owned this since it came out a few years ago. It worked great for a while. I bought a Netgear R8000 router because i thought my wifi signal was weak. (free chromecast with purchase)Well the the problem is to much interference @ 2.4 ghz frequency in my neighborhood. I have over 20 2.4 ghz routers around my house so all i get is this thing searching for data all the time. For the price I cant complain but it doesnt work even for streaming music on my home theater. Im going to purchase the Nexus Player because it supports 802.11ac.
